meanings.definition: Persons in power or in control, especially in a government or organization.
meanings.sent1: The authorities in the government passed new laws.
meanings.sent2: The authorities were responsible for maintaining law and order.
meanings.sent3: The authorities decided to have a pizza party at work.
meanings.sent4: She ruled the classroom with the authority of a queen.
meanings.sent5: The authorities' presence was felt throughout the city.

meanings.definition: A source of information or expertise on a particular subject.
meanings.sent1: The library is a great authority on ancient history.
meanings.sent2: She consulted various authorities before writing her paper.
meanings.sent3: The cat claimed to be an authority on catching mice.
meanings.sent4: His knowledge on the topic made him an authority among his peers.
meanings.sent5: The authority on gardening shared valuable tips with the audience.

meanings.definition: The power or right to give orders, make decisions, and enforce obedience.
meanings.sent1: The principal has the authority to suspend students.
meanings.sent2: The authorities issued a statement regarding the incident.
meanings.sent3: The dog seemed to think he had the authority to command the squirrels.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence gave her the authority to lead the team effectively.
meanings.sent5: The authority of the judge was unquestionable in the courtroom.
